PageTitle: display mpls te p2mp tunnel frr
FuncDef: The display mpls te p2mp tunnel frr command displays information about a bypass tunnel that protects traffic on a P2MP TE tunnel.
CLIs: display mpls te p2mp tunnel frr [ <tunnel-name> ] [ lsp-id <ingress-lsr-id> <session-id> <local-lsp-id> [ s2l-destination <leaf-address> ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about an FRR bypass tunnel.
The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. The tunnel name format, including the upper and lower cases, and blank spaces, must be consistent with that in the configuration file. For example, when a tunnel interface in a configuration file is named "interface Tunnel10", the tunnel name to be specified in this command must also be Tunnel10. "Tunnel10" or "Tunnel 10" is incorrect.

Displays information about an FRR bypass tunnel with a specified LSP ID.
-

Specified LSR ID.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies a session ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

Specified LSP ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

Displays information about an FRR bypass tunnel that protects traffic on a sub-LSP with a specified destination address.
This value is expressed in dotted decimal notation.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display mpls te p2mp tunnel frr Tunnel1
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To view information about a bypass tunnel that protects traffic on a P2MP TE tunnel, run the display mpls te p2mp tunnel frr command. The command output helps you verify that an FRR bypass tunnel is established for a P2MP TE tunnel.
